botanical_details.genus: Lactuca can be annuals, biennials, perennials or shrubs, with alternate leaves, milky white sap and daisy-like flowers in white, yellow or blue. The genus includes a wide range of wild plants, as well as species cultivated for their edible leaves (lettuce)

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in full sun on moisture-retentive soil. Sow a short row every fortnight to ensure continuity of cropping. Use cloches, plastic tunnels or horticultural fleece to protect early and late crops. See the RHS A-Z Guides to vegetable cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed sown in situ, from March to August depending on climate
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs and snails
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds; some resistance to mildew
